lexUnit.name: burn.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be or cause to be harmed or destroyed by fire.

sentence.text: My sister 's burnt her arm , but before you come and dress it , I must tell you that we 're frightfully hard up .
The millionaire band have been forced to pull out of dates in Toronto , Denver and San Diego after Metallica 's James Hetfield burnt his arm .
The ex-England bowler badly burned his arm in the strimmer accident .
I tried it once and burnt my mouth so badly I looked like I 'd been kissing superglue .
A court in the Chinese city of Shanghai sentenced Li Xinghua for disfiguring Pan Ping , 24 , who was burned over 30 per cent of her body , including her face .
` God , Theda ! " he uttered hoarsely , burning his face in the copper tresses that echoed the flaming fire in his loins .
Having burned their fingers two years ago , senior Ford executives will continue to press for change , but preferably not at the expense of another strike .
Stretching out an incautious hand he burnt a finger on one of the bars .
` Are you afraid I may burn my fingers ? "
Then Aunt Bessie had a stroke , more than one in fact , and burned herself rather badly , because she apparently suffered one when she was bending down to tend the fire .
Dustin also found that firing a gun was not something he was adept at , and would often burn himself with the powder from the blank cartridge .
He had stepped into the steam room to be met by a blast of hissing scalding fog which caused him to breath in sharply , thereby promptly burning his nose .
And the fact that they all burned themselves , or tried to .
Lucenzo built a log fire in the big medieval fireplace , and they sat burning their toes on the stone hearth .
It 's also good for sunburn and if you burn yourself .
Patrons not wishing to burn their legs on the metal benches watch from an air-conditioned tier heavy with the reek of cigarettes and beer .
` Larry , " she said , ` I 've just burnt my hand on the oven grid because of you . "
Melanie burned her mouth on scalding tea .
